turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Wiiwish.
turn.2: Wiiwish  Wiiwish, also known as acorn mush, was one of the main food staples of California Indians.
turn.4: Acorns were gathered in the fall before the rain came.
turn.6: To harvest the acorns, California Indians would crack open the shell and pull out the inner part of the acorn.
turn.7: Is there anything else interesting about this article?
turn.8: This part of the acorn was then smashed with a mortar and pestle until it was a flour-like consistency.
turn.9: Do you know how to make the mush?
turn.10: This flour-like substance was then leached several times with water until the acorn mush was no longer bitter (this also indicated that the mush was safe for consumption).
turn.11: What else do you need to know?
turn.12: This mush was then cooked in a waterproof basket with hot rocks and then served.
